Comment.Language: Then the priest covers the oblation with a veil and the chalice with another veil. He covers both with the prospheron, together with the deacon who is facing him; the priest then carefully places another veil upon the prospheron. He kisses the altar and then goes to the south side of it and makes a prostration toward the East, thanking the Lord who has made him worthy of this holy service.
